title: Expose protocol as variable for external tools
author: toubsen
body_snippet:
Externalize the variable "protocol" for usage in the command line of external tools.

## Expected Behavior
I'd like to be able to open connections of type HTTP + HTTPS in an external browser.

## Current Behavior
 Currently, I need to external tool entries, to differentiate between HTTP and HTTPS, to make entries of the following kind:
- `"http://%Hostname%:%PORT%"`
- `"https://%Hostname%:%PORT%"`

Additionally, I need to know in advance if a certain entry is of type HTTP or HTTPS, to ...

comments.author: kees-z
comments.snippet:
Agreed, this should be added, but why not expose **ALL** settings to external apps in the first place? I make intensive use of external apps. I regularly run into limitations because a specific setting cannot be passed to an external app.
Any setting could be sent using a predefined format, like `%GROUP__SETTING%`, for example `%PROTOCOL__USE_CREDSSP%`.
